intro: Erigeron chinensis, commonly known as Chinese fleabane, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a yellow center. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
